member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CancelJournalKinesisStreamRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CancelJournalKinesisStream operation. Ends a given Amazon QLDB journal stream. Before a stream can be canceled, its current status must be ACTIVE.
You can't restart a stream after you cancel it. Canceled QLDB stream resources are subject to a 7-day retention period, so they are automatically deleted after this limit expires.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CancelJournalKinesisStreamRequest.LedgerName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LedgerName.
The name of the ledger.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CancelJournalKinesisStreamRequest.StreamId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamId.
The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the QLDB journal stream to be canceled.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CancelJournalKinesisStream operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CancelJournalKinesisStreamResponse.StreamId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamId.
The UUID (Base62-encoded text) of the canceled QLDB journal stream.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CreateLedgerRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateLedger operation. Creates a new ledger in your account in the current Region.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CreateLedgerRequest.DeletionProtection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeletionProtection.
The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (true) by default.
If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the UpdateLedger operation to set the flag to false.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CreateLedgerRequest.KmsKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKey.
The key in Key Management Service (KMS) to use for encryption of data at rest in the ledger. For more information, see Encryption at rest in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.
Use one of the following options to specify this parameter:
AWS_OWNED_KMS_KEY: Use an KMS key that is owned and managed by Amazon Web Services on your behalf.
Undefined: By default, use an Amazon Web Services owned KMS key.
A valid symmetric customer managed KMS key: Use the specified KMS key in your account that you create, own, and manage.
Amazon QLDB does not support asymmetric keys. For more information, see Using symmetric and asymmetric keys in the Key Management Service Developer Guide.
To specify a customer managed KMS key, you can use its key ID, Amazon Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. When using an alias name, prefix it with "alias/". To specify a key in a different account, you must use the key ARN or alias ARN.
For example:
Key ID: 1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab
Key ARN: arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab
Alias name: alias/ExampleAlias
Alias ARN: arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias
For more information, see Key identifiers (KeyId) in the Key Management Service Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CreateLedgerRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the ledger that you want to create. The name must be unique among all of the ledgers in your account in the current Region.
Naming constraints for ledger names are defined in Quotas in Amazon QLDB in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CreateLedgerRequest.PermissionsMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PermissionsMode.
The permissions mode to assign to the ledger that you want to create. This parameter can have one of the following values:
ALLOW_ALL: A legacy permissions mode that enables access control with API-level granularity for ledgers.
This mode allows users who have the SendCommand API permission for this ledger to run all PartiQL commands (hence, ALLOW_ALL) on any tables in the specified ledger. This mode disregards any table-level or command-level IAM permissions policies that you create for the ledger.
STANDARD: (Recommended) A permissions mode that enables access control with finer granularity for ledgers, tables, and PartiQL commands.
By default, this mode denies all user requests to run any PartiQL commands on any tables in this ledger. To allow PartiQL commands to run, you must create IAM permissions policies for specific table resources and PartiQL actions, in addition to the SendCommand API permission for the ledger. For information, see Getting started with the standard permissions mode in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.
We strongly recommend using the STANDARD permissions mode to maximize the security of your ledger data.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CreateLedgerRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The key-value pairs to add as tags to the ledger that you want to create. Tag keys are case sensitive. Tag values are case sensitive and can be null.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CreateLedgerResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateLedger operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CreateLedgerResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CreateLedgerResponse.CreationDateTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationDateTime.
The date and time, in epoch time format, when the ledger was created. (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CreateLedgerResponse.DeletionProtection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeletionProtection.
The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (true) by default.
If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the UpdateLedger operation to set the flag to false.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CreateLedgerResponse.KmsKeyArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyArn.
The ARN of the customer managed KMS key that the ledger uses for encryption at rest. If this parameter is undefined, the ledger uses an Amazon Web Services owned KMS key for encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CreateLedgerResponse.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the ledger.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CreateLedgerResponse.PermissionsMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PermissionsMode.
The permissions mode of the ledger that you created.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.CreateLedgerResponse.State
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property State.
The current status of the ledger.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.DeleteLedgerRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteLedger operation. Deletes a ledger and all of its contents. This action is irreversible.
If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the UpdateLedger operation to set the flag to false.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the ledger that you want to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.DescribeJournalKinesisStreamRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeJournalKinesisStream operation. Returns detailed information about a given Amazon QLDB journal stream. The output includes the Amazon Resource Name (ARN), stream name, current status, creation time, and the parameters of the original stream creation request.
This action does not return any expired journal streams. For more information, see Expiration for terminal streams in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.DescribeJournalKinesisStreamRequest.LedgerName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LedgerName.
The name of the ledger.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.DescribeJournalKinesisStreamRequest.StreamId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamId.
The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the QLDB journal stream to describe.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.DescribeJournalKinesisStreamResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeJournalKinesisStream operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.DescribeJournalKinesisStreamResponse.Stream
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Stream.
Information about the QLDB journal stream returned by a DescribeJournalS3Export request.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.DescribeJournalS3ExportRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeJournalS3Export operation. Returns information about a journal export job, including the ledger name, export ID, creation time, current status, and the parameters of the original export creation request.
This action does not return any expired export jobs. For more information, see Export job expiration in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.
If the export job with the given ExportId doesn't exist, then throws ResourceNotFoundException.
If the ledger with the given Name doesn't exist, then throws ResourceNotFoundException.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.DescribeJournalS3ExportRequest.ExportId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExportId.
The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the journal export job to describe.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.DescribeJournalS3ExportRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the ledger.

member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeJournalS3Export operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.DescribeJournalS3ExportResponse.ExportDescription
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExportDescription.
Information about the journal export job returned by a DescribeJournalS3Export request.

member.summary:

The date and time, in epoch time format, when the ledger was created. (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.DescribeLedgerResponse.DeletionProtection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeletionProtection.
The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (true) by default.
If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the UpdateLedger operation to set the flag to false.

member.summary:

Information about the encryption of data at rest in the ledger. This includes the current status, the KMS key, and when the key became inaccessible (in the case of an error).

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ExportJournalToS3Request
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ExportJournalToS3 operation. Exports journal contents within a date and time range from a ledger into a specified Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket. The data is written as files in Amazon Ion format.
If the ledger with the given Name doesn't exist, then throws ResourceNotFoundException.
If the ledger with the given Name is in CREATING status, then throws ResourcePreconditionNotMetException.
You can initiate up to two concurrent journal export requests for each ledger. Beyond this limit, journal export requests throw LimitExceededException.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ExportJournalToS3Request.ExclusiveEndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusiveEndTime.
The exclusive end date and time for the range of journal contents to export.
The ExclusiveEndTime must be in ISO 8601 date and time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example: 2019-06-13T21:36:34Z.
The ExclusiveEndTime must be less than or equal to the current UTC date and time.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ExportJournalToS3Request.InclusiveStartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusiveStartTime.
The inclusive start date and time for the range of journal contents to export.
The InclusiveStartTime must be in ISO 8601 date and time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example: 2019-06-13T21:36:34Z.
The InclusiveStartTime must be before ExclusiveEndTime.
If you provide an InclusiveStartTime that is before the ledger's CreationDateTime, Amazon QLDB defaults it to the ledger's CreationDateTime.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ExportJournalToS3Request.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the ledger.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ExportJournalToS3Request.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB permissions for a journal export job to do the following:
Write objects into your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket.
(Optional) Use your customer master key (CMK) in Key Management Service (KMS) for server-side encryption of your exported data.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ExportJournalToS3Request.S3ExportConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3ExportConfiguration.
The configuration settings of the Amazon S3 bucket destination for your export request.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ExportJournalToS3Response
member.summary: This is the response object from the ExportJournalToS3 operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ExportJournalToS3Response.ExportId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExportId.
The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) that QLDB assigns to each journal export job.
To describe your export request and check the status of the job, you can use ExportId to call DescribeJournalS3Export.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetBlockRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetBlock operation. Returns a block object at a specified address in a journal. Also returns a proof of the specified block for verification if DigestTipAddress is provided.
For information about the data contents in a block, see Journal contents in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.
If the specified ledger doesn't exist or is in DELETING status, then throws ResourceNotFoundException.
If the specified ledger is in CREATING status, then throws ResourcePreconditionNotMetException.
If no block exists with the specified address, then throws InvalidParameterException.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetBlockRequest.BlockAddress
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockAddress.
The location of the block that you want to request. An address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields: strandId and sequenceNo.
For example: {strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:14}.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetBlockRequest.DigestTipAddress
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DigestTipAddress.
The latest block location covered by the digest for which to request a proof. An address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields: strandId and sequenceNo.
For example: {strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:49}.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetBlockRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the ledger.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetBlockResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetBlock operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetBlockResponse.Block
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Block.
The block data object in Amazon Ion format.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetBlockResponse.Proof
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Proof.
The proof object in Amazon Ion format returned by a GetBlock request. A proof contains the list of hash values required to recalculate the specified digest using a Merkle tree, starting with the specified block.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetDigestRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetDigest operation. Returns the digest of a ledger at the latest committed block in the journal. The response includes a 256-bit hash value and a block address.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetDigestRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the ledger.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetDigestResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetDigest operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetDigestResponse.Digest
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Digest.
The 256-bit hash value representing the digest returned by a GetDigest request.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetDigestResponse.DigestTipAddress
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DigestTipAddress.
The latest block location covered by the digest that you requested. An address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields: strandId and sequenceNo.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetRevisionRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetRevision operation. Returns a revision data object for a specified document ID and block address. Also returns a proof of the specified revision for verification if DigestTipAddress is provided.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetRevisionRequest.BlockAddress
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockAddress.
The block location of the document revision to be verified. An address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields: strandId and sequenceNo.
For example: {strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:14}.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetRevisionRequest.DigestTipAddress
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DigestTipAddress.
The latest block location covered by the digest for which to request a proof. An address is an Amazon Ion structure that has two fields: strandId and sequenceNo.
For example: {strandId:"BlFTjlSXze9BIh1KOszcE3",sequenceNo:49}.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetRevisionRequest.DocumentId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DocumentId.
The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the document to be verified.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetRevisionRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the ledger.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetRevisionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetRevision operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetRevisionResponse.Proof
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Proof.
The proof object in Amazon Ion format returned by a GetRevision request. A proof contains the list of hash values that are required to recalculate the specified digest using a Merkle tree, starting with the specified document revision.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetRevisionResponse.Revision
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Revision.
The document revision data object in Amazon Ion format.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalKinesisStreamDescription
member.summary: Information about an Amazon QLDB journal stream, including the Amazon Resource Name (ARN), stream name, creation time, current status, and the parameters of the original stream creation request.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the QLDB journal stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.CreationTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationTime.
The date and time, in epoch time format, when the QLDB journal stream was created. (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.ErrorCause
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorCause.
The error message that describes the reason that a stream has a status of IMPAIRED or FAILED. This is not applicable to streams that have other status values.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.ExclusiveEndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusiveEndTime.
The exclusive date and time that specifies when the stream ends. If this parameter is undefined, the stream runs indefinitely until you cancel it.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.InclusiveStartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusiveStartTime.
The inclusive start date and time from which to start streaming journal data.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.KinesisConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KinesisConfiguration.
The configuration settings of the Amazon Kinesis Data Streams destination for a QLDB journal stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.LedgerName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LedgerName.
The name of the ledger.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB permissions for a journal stream to write data records to a Kinesis Data Streams resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current state of the QLDB journal stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.StreamId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamId.
The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the QLDB journal stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalKinesisStreamDescription.StreamName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamName.
The user-defined name of the QLDB journal stream.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalS3ExportDescription
member.summary: Information about a journal export job, including the ledger name, export ID, creation time, current status, and the parameters of the original export creation request.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalS3ExportDescription.ExclusiveEndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusiveEndTime.
The exclusive end date and time for the range of journal contents that are specified in the original export request.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalS3ExportDescription.ExportCreationTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExportCreationTime.
The date and time, in epoch time format, when the export job was created. (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalS3ExportDescription.ExportId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExportId.
The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) of the journal export job.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalS3ExportDescription.InclusiveStartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusiveStartTime.
The inclusive start date and time for the range of journal contents that are specified in the original export request.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalS3ExportDescription.LedgerName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LedgerName.
The name of the ledger.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalS3ExportDescription.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB permissions for a journal export job to do the following:
Write objects into your Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket.
(Optional) Use your customer master key (CMK) in Key Management Service (KMS) for server-side encryption of your exported data.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalS3ExportDescription.S3ExportConfiguration
member.summary: Gets and sets the property S3ExportConfiguration.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.JournalS3ExportDescription.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current state of the journal export job.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.KinesisConfiguration
member.summary: The configuration settings of the Amazon Kinesis Data Streams destination for an Amazon QLDB journal stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.KinesisConfiguration.AggregationEnabled
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AggregationEnabled.
Enables QLDB to publish multiple data records in a single Kinesis Data Streams record, increasing the number of records sent per API call.
This option is enabled by default. Record aggregation has important implications for processing records and requires de-aggregation in your stream consumer. To learn more, see KPL Key Concepts and Consumer De-aggregation in the Amazon Kinesis Data Streams Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.KinesisConfiguration.StreamArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Kinesis Data Streams resource.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.LedgerEncryptionDescription
member.summary:
Information about the encryption of data at rest in an Amazon QLDB ledger. This includes the current status, the key in Key Management Service (KMS), and when the key became inaccessible (in the case of an error).
For more information, see Encryption at rest in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.LedgerEncryptionDescription.EncryptionStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionStatus.
The current state of encryption at rest for the ledger. This can be one of the following values:
ENABLED: Encryption is fully enabled using the specified key.
UPDATING: The ledger is actively processing the specified key change.
Key changes in QLDB are asynchronous. The ledger is fully accessible without any performance impact while the key change is being processed. The amount of time it takes to update a key varies depending on the ledger size.
KMS_KEY_INACCESSIBLE: The specified customer managed KMS key is not accessible, and the ledger is impaired. Either the key was disabled or deleted, or the grants on the key were revoked. When a ledger is impaired, it is not accessible and does not accept any read or write requests.
An impaired ledger automatically returns to an active state after you restore the grants on the key, or re-enable the key that was disabled. However, deleting a customer managed KMS key is irreversible. After a key is deleted, you can no longer access the ledgers that are protected with that key, and the data becomes unrecoverable permanently.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.LedgerEncryptionDescription.InaccessibleKmsKeyDateTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InaccessibleKmsKeyDateTime.
The date and time, in epoch time format, when the KMS key first became inaccessible, in the case of an error. (Epoch time format is the number of seconds that have elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)
This parameter is undefined if the KMS key is accessible.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.LedgerEncryptionDescription.KmsKeyArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the customer managed KMS key that the ledger uses for encryption at rest. If this parameter is undefined, the ledger uses an Amazon Web Services owned KMS key for encryption.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.LedgerSummary

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedgerRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedger operation. Returns an array of all Amazon QLDB journal stream descriptors for a given ledger. The output of each stream descriptor includes the same details that are returned by DescribeJournalKinesisStream.
This action does not return any expired journal streams. For more information, see Expiration for terminal streams in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.
This action returns a maximum of MaxResults items. It is paginated so that you can retrieve all the items by calling ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedger multiple times.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedgerRequest.LedgerName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LedgerName.
The name of the ledger.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedgerRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of results to return in a single ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedger request. (The actual number of results returned might be fewer.)

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedgerRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
A pagination token, indicating that you want to retrieve the next page of results. If you received a value for NextToken in the response from a previous ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedger call, you should use that value as input here.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedgerResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedger operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedgerResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
If NextToken is empty, the last page of results has been processed and there are no more results to be retrieved.
If NextToken is not empty, more results are available. To retrieve the next page of results, use the value of NextToken in a subsequent ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedger call.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ListJournalKinesisStreamsForLedgerResponse.Streams
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Streams.
The array of QLDB journal stream descriptors that are associated with the given ledger.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ListJournalS3ExportsForLedgerRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListJournalS3ExportsForLedger operation. Returns an array of journal export job descriptions for a specified ledger.
This action returns a maximum of MaxResults items, and is paginated so that you can retrieve all the items by calling ListJournalS3ExportsForLedger multiple times.
This action does not return any expired export jobs. For more information, see Export job expiration in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.ListJournalS3ExportsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListJournalS3Exports operation. Returns an array of journal export job descriptions for all ledgers that are associated with the current account and Region.
This action returns a maximum of MaxResults items, and is paginated so that you can retrieve all the items by calling ListJournalS3Exports multiple times.
This action does not return any expired export jobs. For more information, see Export job expiration in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.S3EncryptionConfiguration
member.summary: The encryption settings that are used by a journal export job to write data in an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.S3EncryptionConfiguration.KmsKeyArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a symmetric customer master key (CMK) in Key Management Service (KMS). Amazon S3 does not support asymmetric CMKs.
You must provide a KmsKeyArn if you specify SSE_KMS as the ObjectEncryptionType.
KmsKeyArn is not required if you specify SSE_S3 as the ObjectEncryptionType.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.S3EncryptionConfiguration.ObjectEncryptionType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ObjectEncryptionType.
The Amazon S3 object encryption type.
To learn more about server-side encryption options in Amazon S3, see Protecting Data Using Server-Side Encryption in the Amazon S3 Developer Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.S3ExportConfiguration
member.summary: The Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket location in which a journal export job writes the journal contents.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.S3ExportConfiguration.Bucket
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Bucket.
The Amazon S3 bucket name in which a journal export job writes the journal contents.
The bucket name must comply with the Amazon S3 bucket naming conventions. For more information, see Bucket Restrictions and Limitations in the Amazon S3 Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.S3ExportConfiguration.EncryptionConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionConfiguration.
The encryption settings that are used by a journal export job to write data in an Amazon S3 bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.S3ExportConfiguration.Prefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Prefix.
The prefix for the Amazon S3 bucket in which a journal export job writes the journal contents.
The prefix must comply with Amazon S3 key naming rules and restrictions. For more information, see Object Key and Metadata in the Amazon S3 Developer Guide.
The following are examples of valid Prefix values:
JournalExports-ForMyLedger/Testing/
JournalExports
My:Tests/

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.StreamJournalToKinesisRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the StreamJournalToKinesis operation. Creates a journal stream for a given Amazon QLDB ledger. The stream captures every document revision that is committed to the ledger's journal and delivers the data to a specified Amazon Kinesis Data Streams resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.StreamJournalToKinesisRequest.ExclusiveEndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExclusiveEndTime.
The exclusive date and time that specifies when the stream ends. If you don't define this parameter, the stream runs indefinitely until you cancel it.
The ExclusiveEndTime must be in ISO 8601 date and time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example: 2019-06-13T21:36:34Z.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.StreamJournalToKinesisRequest.InclusiveStartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InclusiveStartTime.
The inclusive start date and time from which to start streaming journal data. This parameter must be in ISO 8601 date and time format and in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). For example: 2019-06-13T21:36:34Z.
The InclusiveStartTime cannot be in the future and must be before ExclusiveEndTime.
If you provide an InclusiveStartTime that is before the ledger's CreationDateTime, QLDB effectively defaults it to the ledger's CreationDateTime.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.StreamJournalToKinesisRequest.KinesisConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KinesisConfiguration.
The configuration settings of the Kinesis Data Streams destination for your stream request.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.StreamJournalToKinesisRequest.LedgerName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LedgerName.
The name of the ledger.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.StreamJournalToKinesisRequest.RoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that grants QLDB permissions for a journal stream to write data records to a Kinesis Data Streams resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.StreamJournalToKinesisRequest.StreamName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamName.
The name that you want to assign to the QLDB journal stream. User-defined names can help identify and indicate the purpose of a stream.
Your stream name must be unique among other active streams for a given ledger. Stream names have the same naming constraints as ledger names, as defined in Quotas in Amazon QLDB in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.StreamJournalToKinesisRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The key-value pairs to add as tags to the stream that you want to create. Tag keys are case sensitive. Tag values are case sensitive and can be null.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.StreamJournalToKinesisResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StreamJournalToKinesis operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.StreamJournalToKinesisResponse.StreamId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StreamId.
The UUID (represented in Base62-encoded text) that QLDB assigns to each QLDB journal stream.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.TagResourceRequest.Tags

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode operation. Updates the permissions mode of a ledger.
Before you switch to the STANDARD permissions mode, you must first create all required IAM policies and table tags to avoid disruption to your users. To learn more, see Migrating to the standard permissions mode in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the ledger.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeRequest.PermissionsMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PermissionsMode.
The permissions mode to assign to the ledger. This parameter can have one of the following values:
ALLOW_ALL: A legacy permissions mode that enables access control with API-level granularity for ledgers.
This mode allows users who have the SendCommand API permission for this ledger to run all PartiQL commands (hence, ALLOW_ALL) on any tables in the specified ledger. This mode disregards any table-level or command-level IAM permissions policies that you create for the ledger.
STANDARD: (Recommended) A permissions mode that enables access control with finer granularity for ledgers, tables, and PartiQL commands.
By default, this mode denies all user requests to run any PartiQL commands on any tables in this ledger. To allow PartiQL commands to run, you must create IAM permissions policies for specific table resources and PartiQL actions, in addition to the SendCommand API permission for the ledger. For information, see Getting started with the standard permissions mode in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.
We strongly recommend using the STANDARD permissions mode to maximize the security of your ledger data.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateLedgerPermissionsMode operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the ledger.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the ledger.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.UpdateLedgerPermissionsModeResponse.PermissionsMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PermissionsMode.
The current permissions mode of the ledger.

member.name: T:Amazon.QLDB.Model.UpdateLedgerRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateLedger operation. Updates properties on a ledger.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.UpdateLedgerRequest.DeletionProtection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeletionProtection.
The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (true) by default.
If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the UpdateLedger operation to set the flag to false.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.UpdateLedgerRequest.KmsKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKey.
The key in Key Management Service (KMS) to use for encryption of data at rest in the ledger. For more information, see Encryption at rest in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.
Use one of the following options to specify this parameter:
AWS_OWNED_KMS_KEY: Use an KMS key that is owned and managed by Amazon Web Services on your behalf.
Undefined: Make no changes to the KMS key of the ledger.
A valid symmetric customer managed KMS key: Use the specified KMS key in your account that you create, own, and manage.
Amazon QLDB does not support asymmetric keys. For more information, see Using symmetric and asymmetric keys in the Key Management Service Developer Guide.
To specify a customer managed KMS key, you can use its key ID, Amazon Resource Name (ARN), alias name, or alias ARN. When using an alias name, prefix it with "alias/". To specify a key in a different account, you must use the key ARN or alias ARN.
For example:
Key ID: 1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab
Key ARN: arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab
Alias name: alias/ExampleAlias
Alias ARN: arn:aws:kms:us-east-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias
For more information, see Key identifiers (KeyId) in the Key Management Service Developer Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.UpdateLedgerRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the ledger.

member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateLedger operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.UpdateLedgerResponse.CreationDateTime
member.summary:

The date and time, in epoch time format, when the ledger was created. (Epoch time format is the number of seconds elapsed since 12:00:00 AM January 1, 1970 UTC.)

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.UpdateLedgerResponse.DeletionProtection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeletionProtection.
The flag that prevents a ledger from being deleted by any user. If not provided on ledger creation, this feature is enabled (true) by default.
If deletion protection is enabled, you must first disable it before you can delete the ledger. You can disable it by calling the UpdateLedger operation to set the flag to false.

member.name: P:Amazon.QLDB.Model.UpdateLedgerResponse.EncryptionDescription
member.summary:

Information about the encryption of data at rest in the ledger. This includes the current status, the KMS key, and when the key became inaccessible (in the case of an error).

member.name: M:Amazon.QLDB.AmazonQLDBClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonQLDBClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.QLDB.AmazonQLDBClient.CancelJournalKinesisStream(Amazon.QLDB.Model.CancelJournalKinesisStreamRequest)
member.summary:
Ends a given Amazon QLDB journal stream. Before a stream can be canceled, its current status must be ACTIVE.
You can't restart a stream after you cancel it. Canceled QLDB stream resources are subject to a 7-day retention period, so they are automatically deleted after this limit expires.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the CancelJournalKinesisStream service method.
member.returns: The response from the CancelJournalKinesisStream service method, as returned by QLDB.
member.exception: One or more parameters in the request aren't valid.
The specified resource doesn't exist.
The operation failed because a condition wasn't satisfied in advance.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for CancelJournalKinesisStream Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.QLDB.AmazonQLDBClient.DescribeJournalKinesisStream(Amazon.QLDB.Model.DescribeJournalKinesisStreamRequest)
member.summary:
Returns detailed information about a given Amazon QLDB journal stream. The output includes the Amazon Resource Name (ARN), stream name, current status, creation time, and the parameters of the original stream creation request.
This action does not return any expired journal streams. For more information, see Expiration for terminal streams in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.QLDB.AmazonQLDBClient.DescribeJournalS3Export(Amazon.QLDB.Model.DescribeJournalS3ExportRequest)
member.summary:
Returns information about a journal export job, including the ledger name, export ID, creation time, current status, and the parameters of the original export creation request.
This action does not return any expired export jobs. For more information, see Export job expiration in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.
If the export job with the given ExportId doesn't exist, then throws ResourceNotFoundException.
If the ledger with the given Name doesn't exist, then throws ResourceNotFoundException.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the DescribeJournalS3Export service method.
member.returns: The response from the DescribeJournalS3Export service method, as returned by QLDB.
member.exception: The specified resource doesn't exist.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for DescribeJournalS3Export Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.QLDB.AmazonQLDBClient.ExportJournalToS3(Amazon.QLDB.Model.ExportJournalToS3Request)
member.summary:
Exports journal contents within a date and time range from a ledger into a specified Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket. The data is written as files in Amazon Ion format.
If the ledger with the given Name doesn't exist, then throws ResourceNotFoundException.
If the ledger with the given Name is in CREATING status, then throws ResourcePreconditionNotMetException.
You can initiate up to two concurrent journal export requests for each ledger. Beyond this limit, journal export requests throw LimitExceededException.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ExportJournalToS3 service method.
member.returns: The response from the ExportJournalToS3 service method, as returned by QLDB.
member.exception: The specified resource doesn't exist.
The operation failed because a condition wasn't satisfied in advance.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for ExportJournalToS3 Operation

If the ledger with the given Name is in CREATING status, then throws ResourcePreconditionNotMetException.
You can initiate up to two concurrent journal export requests for each ledger. Beyond this limit, journal export requests throw LimitExceededException.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ExportJournalToS3 service method.

member.name: M:Amazon.QLDB.AmazonQLDBClient.GetBlock(Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetBlockRequest)
member.summary:
Returns a block object at a specified address in a journal. Also returns a proof of the specified block for verification if DigestTipAddress is provided.
For information about the data contents in a block, see Journal contents in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.
If the specified ledger doesn't exist or is in DELETING status, then throws ResourceNotFoundException.
If the specified ledger is in CREATING status, then throws ResourcePreconditionNotMetException.
If no block exists with the specified address, then throws InvalidParameterException.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetBlock service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetBlock service method, as returned by QLDB.
member.exception: One or more parameters in the request aren't valid.
The specified resource doesn't exist.
The operation failed because a condition wasn't satisfied in advance.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetBlock Operation

For information about the data contents in a block, see Journal contents in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.QLDB.IAmazonQLDB.ExportJournalToS3(Amazon.QLDB.Model.ExportJournalToS3Request)
member.summary:
Exports journal contents within a date and time range from a ledger into a specified Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket. The data is written as files in Amazon Ion format.
If the ledger with the given Name doesn't exist, then throws ResourceNotFoundException.
If the ledger with the given Name is in CREATING status, then throws ResourcePreconditionNotMetException.
You can initiate up to two concurrent journal export requests for each ledger. Beyond this limit, journal export requests throw LimitExceededException.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ExportJournalToS3 service method.

member.name: M:Amazon.QLDB.IAmazonQLDB.GetBlock(Amazon.QLDB.Model.GetBlockRequest)
member.summary:
Returns a block object at a specified address in a journal. Also returns a proof of the specified block for verification if DigestTipAddress is provided.
For information about the data contents in a block, see Journal contents in the Amazon QLDB Developer Guide.
If the specified ledger doesn't exist or is in DELETING status, then throws ResourceNotFoundException.
If the specified ledger is in CREATING status, then throws ResourcePreconditionNotMetException.
If no block exists with the specified address, then throws InvalidParameterException.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetBlock service method.
member.returns: The response from the GetBlock service method, as returned by QLDB.
